    • Constructor Detail

      • VFS

        public VFS(long maxSpace,
           java.nio.file.Path path)
    throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        maxSpace - : the maximum storage space of the VFS, i.e the size of the VFS file on the host file system.
        path - : the path pointing to the future emplacement of the .vfs file (including the name.vfs) This constructor creates a new VFS in the concrete file system with the specified maxSpace size, and initialize it. The initialisation process implies : - adaptation of the the path - creation of the root VDirectory
        Throws:
        if - the file location given by path cannot be written, an IOException will be thrown.
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • getRoot

        public fr.ecp.IS1220.FinalProject.Vasselin.core.VDirectory getRoot()
        Returns:
        the root VDIrectory, containing all the elements of the VFS.

      • getMaxSpace

        public long getMaxSpace()
        Returns:
        the maximum authorised total size of the .vfs file in the host file system, in bytes. Note that due to the storage of the data structure, the total amount of actual data stored in this VFS is smaller than getMaxSpace().

      • getActualFile

        public java.io.File getActualFile()
        Returns:
        the file where the .vfs file corresponding to this is stored (in the hosting file system)

      • setActualFile

        public void setActualFile(java.io.File actualFile)
        Parameters:
        actualFile - : the new file in the hosting file system where the .vfs file will be stored when save() is called.

      • getFreeSpace

        public long getFreeSpace()
        Returns:
        getFreeSpace COMPUTES the free space of this VFS.

      • save

        public void save()
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 fr.ecp.IS1220.FinalProject.Vasselin.core.MaxSizeExceededException
        Saves the content of this VFS to the hard-drive. The length of the actual .vfs file in the hosting file system may be larger than getMaxSpace(), because of the space taken by the data structure.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - may be thrown if the location getActualFilePath() can no longer be written.
        fr.ecp.IS1220.FinalProject.Vasselin.core.MaxSizeExceededException - is thrown if the current size of the VFS is larger than getMaxSize().

      • load

        public static VFS load(java.nio.file.Path path)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       fr.ecp.IS1220.FinalProject.Vasselin.core.NotAVFSException
        Creates a VFS from a .vfs file in the host file system.
        Parameters:
        path - : must point to the .vfs file (including the ".vfs")
        Returns:
        a VFS corresponding to the one written on the hard-drive targeted by path
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the path is invalid or the location can't be read.
        fr.ecp.IS1220.FinalProject.Vasselin.core.NotAVFSException - if path doesn't point to a VFS.

      • delete

        public void delete()
            throws java.lang.SecurityException
        Deletes the .vfs file in the host file system.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - is thrown if the .vfs file is no longer accessible.

      • getPath

        public fr.ecp.IS1220.FinalProject.Vasselin.core.VItem getPath(java.lang.String path)
                                                       throws fr.ecp.IS1220.FinalProject.Vasselin.core.InvalidPathException
        Returns the VItem at the location designated by path in the VFS.
        Parameters:
        path - : the path to the wanted file/directory in the VFS. The directories should be separated by "/". The "root/" at the beginning of the path may be omitted.
        Returns:
        the VItem which path points to
        Throws:
        fr.ecp.IS1220.FinalProject.Vasselin.core.InvalidPathException - is thrown if path doesn't point to any existing file.

      • search

        public java.util.List<fr.ecp.IS1220.FinalProject.Vasselin.core.VItem> search(java.lang.String name)
        Finds all the VItems named name, using a simple breadth-first search.
        Parameters:
        name - : the name of the researched items
        Returns:
        a List of VItem, containing all the items of the VFS with the name "name"
